name: Grandma Bonnie's Cinnamon Rolls
author: Priscilla
summary: These are my grandma's cinnamon rolls. A favorite at Christmas or just a Saturday morning.
ingredients: ¼ cup vegetable oil, or more as needed
6 ½ cups all-purpose flour, or more as needed
½ cup white sugar, or more to taste
¼ cup ground cinnamon, or more to taste
½ cup chopped pecans, or to taste
1 tablespoon milk, or more as needed
2 tablespoons chopped pecans, or to taste
directions: Combine water, yeast, and 1 tablespoon sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment
Let sit until foamy, about 5 minutes
Add remaining sugar, 1/4 cup oil, egg, and salt; mix until combined
Scrape paddle attachment and switch to the dough hook
Mix in flour, 1 cup at a time, until dough comes away from the sides of the bowl
Continue kneading for about 3 more minutes
Add a bit of oil on the dough and roll the dough in the bowl until all sides are coated
Cover with a towel and let rise until at least doubled in size, about 45 minutes
Punch down the dough and transfer to a floured surface
Roll out into a rectangle
Pour melted butter onto the dough and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon to taste
Add pecans
Roll up lengthwise and cut into 12 rolls
Transfer to a greased 9x13-inch baking dish and let rise for 15 minutes
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown in color, about 15 minutes
While the rolls are baking, combine powdered sugar, melted butter, and vanilla for topping
Add 1 tablespoon milk and mix to a pourable consistency, adding more if necessary
Remove rolls from the oven
Immediately pour topping over top and sprinkle with pecans
